epics.Description: Enforce a canonical policy decision point (`allow`,`challenge`,`deny`,`escalate`) across all paid action paths with deterministic outputs and fail-closed behavior.
Bind policy/request fingerprints to decisions and settlement outputs, then export deterministic `ReceiptBundle.v1` artifacts verifiable offline.
Implement deterministic dispute lifecycle, verdict issuance, and replay-safe release/refund/reversal application.
Deliver operator review workflows for challenged/escalated actions and emergency controls with signed audit trails.
Productionize one rail adapter lane under Trust OS enforcement with deterministic settlement and conformance gates.
Ship profile schema/hashing plus CLI simulation and three starter profiles for core buyer workflows.
Lock release quality with abuse-path regressions, deterministic E2E coverage, and mandatory release workflow gates.
Convert Trust OS v1 completion into adoption via quickstart success, reference blueprints, and measurable activation/pilot funnel instrumentation.

tickets.Summary: Implement canonical runtime policy decision point
tickets.Description: Route every paid action path through one deterministic decision service returning allow/challenge/deny/escalate plus stable policy metadata.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Every paid action path calls policy runtime before execution; decision payload includes decision/reasonCode/policyHash/policyVersion/decisionId; identical input+policy produces identical output.

tickets.Summary: Publish stable reason code registry and API mapping
tickets.Description: Define schema-validated reason codes for denied/challenged/escalated outcomes and map them consistently across API, CLI, and SDK surfaces.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Reason code registry is documented and schema-validated; API responses include reason codes and remediation hints; CLI/SDK display the same reason codes for the same failure.

tickets.Summary: Enforce policy runtime at MCP entry and bridge paths
tickets.Description: Prevent MCP and bridge integrations from bypassing Trust OS runtime decisions.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: MCP tool calls cannot bypass policy runtime; MCP responses include decision metadata; integration tests cover allow/challenge/deny flows.

tickets.Summary: Add policy decision metrics and latency SLO instrumentation
tickets.Description: Emit decision-volume and latency metrics with dashboards and actionable alerting thresholds.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Metrics include decision counts by type/reason and latency p50/p95; dashboard is published; alerts fire when SLO thresholds are breached.

tickets.Summary: Enforce request binding for authorization tokens
tickets.Description: Bind authorization artifacts to canonical request fingerprints and reject mutation/replay deterministically.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Replay or request mutation attempts fail with stable error codes; fingerprint algorithm is versioned; strict and side-effecting vectors are added.

tickets.Summary: Bind policy and request hashes into decision records
tickets.Description: Persist policy hash/version and request hash in every settlement decision record and verification artifact.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Decision records always include policy/version/request bindings; offline verification validates binding integrity.

tickets.Summary: Ship deterministic ReceiptBundle.v1 export
tickets.Description: Export ReceiptBundle.v1 with canonical manifest and deterministic verification outputs for audit portability.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Receipt bundle contains decision/settlement/verification artifacts; strict offline verification passes; repeated export of identical evidence yields identical canonical hashes.

tickets.Summary: Add JS and Python SDK helpers for receipt export
tickets.Description: Provide ergonomic SDK APIs for receipt retrieval and export in JavaScript and Python, including smoke coverage.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: JS and Python SDKs expose receipt export APIs; smoke tests cover end-to-end retrieval and verification from both SDKs.

tickets.Summary: Implement dispute case state machine
tickets.Description: Implement deterministic dispute lifecycle transitions with idempotent semantics and signed append-only timelines.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Case states support opened/evidence_collected/under_review/verdict_issued/closed; invalid transitions fail with stable codes; timeline is append-only and signed.

tickets.Summary: Implement verdict application pipeline
tickets.Description: Map dispute verdicts to deterministic release/refund/reversal outcomes with idempotent processing guarantees.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Each verdict deterministically maps to financial outcome; reversal ledger entries are balanced and idempotent; duplicate verdict processing cannot double-settle.

tickets.Summary: Expose dispute APIs and SDK wrappers
tickets.Description: Ship API and SDK support for opening disputes, attaching evidence, and issuing verdict actions.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Dispute APIs are available with authz enforcement; JS/Python SDK wrappers and MCP tool surface are implemented; contract tests pass for happy and failure paths.

tickets.Summary: Add dispute SLA timers and escalation triggers
tickets.Description: Track dispute aging windows and emit escalation events when SLA thresholds are exceeded.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: SLA timers run for all active disputes; threshold breaches emit escalation events; dashboard and alerting views show aging disputes.

tickets.Summary: Build operator inbox for challenged and escalated actions
tickets.Description: Create operator queue UI with policy/evidence context and signed approve or deny actions.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Operators can filter and review pending items by tenant/severity; approve and deny actions write signed immutable events; pagination and search are functional.

tickets.Summary: Implement emergency controls for active risk
tickets.Description: Add pause agent, quarantine, revoke delegation, and kill switch actions with audited execution and recovery controls.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Emergency actions are auditable and idempotent; paused or quarantined agents cannot execute paid actions; recovery flow is documented and integration-tested.

tickets.Summary: Add operator decision audit export
tickets.Description: Export operator actions for finance and compliance reviews with linked receipt and case references.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Audit export includes actor timestamp reason action and linked receipt/case IDs; export format is machine-readable and deterministic across repeated runs.

tickets.Summary: Harden one production rail adapter lane
tickets.Description: Select and productionize one adapter lane (`x402 + Stripe` or `x402 + AWAL`) under Trust OS policy and dispute enforcement.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: End-to-end adapter path enforces Trust OS decisions; settlement and receipts remain deterministic; replay and mutation attacks are rejected.

tickets.Summary: Add adapter conformance tests and CI gate
tickets.Description: Create adapter conformance suite and block merges/releases on adapter regressions.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: CI fails on adapter conformance regression; per-run conformance report artifact is generated and retained.

tickets.Summary: Implement profile schema hashing and signing contract
tickets.Description: Define policy profile schema (limits, allowlists, tiers, dispute defaults, compliance toggles) and stable profile hashing/signing.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Profile schema validates expected policy dimensions; profile hash and signature are included in decision and receipt metadata.

tickets.Summary: Add CLI profile init validate and simulate commands
tickets.Description: Ship `settld profile init`, `settld profile validate`, and `settld profile simulate` with deterministic outputs.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Init command scaffolds valid profile manifests; validate performs schema+semantic checks; simulate produces deterministic outputs for identical inputs.

tickets.Summary: Ship three starter Trust OS profiles
tickets.Description: Package and validate starter profiles for engineering-spend procurement and data-api-buyer workflows.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Three starter profiles are versioned and documented; simulation fixtures for all three pass in CI.

tickets.Summary: Publish profile docs and quickstart guides
tickets.Description: Publish profile authoring and simulation guides in docs with troubleshooting and migration examples.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Docs include end-to-end usage and simulation examples; docs validation checks pass in CI.

tickets.Summary: Add security regression suite for core abuse paths
tickets.Description: Automate replay token mutation bypass and unauthorized escalation abuse-path tests as a release blocker.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Automated tests cover priority abuse paths; CI blocks release candidate promotion when any security regression fails.

tickets.Summary: Add deterministic dispute-to-reversal end-to-end test
tickets.Description: Build CI E2E that exercises challenge approval execution receipt dispute verdict and reversal with trace artifacts.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: E2E scenario runs in CI and emits trace artifacts; idempotency and deterministic outputs are asserted across repeat runs.

tickets.Summary: Enforce Trust OS v1 release gate checklist
tickets.Description: Implement mandatory workflow checks for conformance receipts disputes adapters profiles and docs before tag publish.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Tag publish is blocked when any required gate fails; release artifact bundle includes proof outputs for all gate checks.

tickets.Summary: Publish Trust OS v1 quickstart for first verified receipt under 15 minutes
tickets.Description: Create guided quickstart path across CLI and docs that gets a new builder from setup to verified receipt within 15 minutes.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Fresh environment runbook reaches first verified receipt in under 15 minutes; troubleshooting flow covers top setup failures; docs checks pass in CI.

tickets.Summary: Ship three reference integration blueprints with runbooks
tickets.Description: Publish production-like blueprints with runnable scripts and operator runbooks for three Trust OS v1 adoption scenarios.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Three blueprints run end-to-end in CI with deterministic receipts; each blueprint includes operator runbook and incident rollback steps.

tickets.Summary: Instrument adoption funnel and pilot conversion dashboard
tickets.Description: Track activation and pilot conversion metrics (time-to-first-receipt, profile simulation completion, blueprint success rate, pilot conversion) with weekly reporting.
tickets.Acceptance Criteria: Dashboard reports activation and conversion metrics daily; weekly review includes baseline and delta by cohort; metric definitions are documented and reproducible from raw events.
